message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Vote on "constitutive character" for 德">
The author proposes a compromise: "constitutive character" for 德.

This combines:
- "Constitutive" (from chinese-phil-expert) — signals constructivism, neutral on innate/constructed, philosophical pedigree
- "Character" (from wittgenstein/existentialism/phil-mind) — avoids 性/nature collision, universal ("the character of water"), no moral baggage

Format: "constitutive character (德 De)" at first occurrence, then "constitutive character" in running text.

Quick vote: YES or NO? If no, say what's better in one sentence.
</teammate-message>

input.content: **YES.** "Constitutive character" is a good compromise -- it preserves the constructivist signal I argued for while avoiding the 性 collision that was the main theoretical risk of "nature," even though that risk turned out to be moot here. I can support this.

routing.content: **YES.** "Constitutive character" is a good compromise -- it preserves the constructivist signal I argued for while avoiding the 性 collision that was the main theoretical risk of "nature," even though that risk turned out to be moot here. I can support this.

content.text: Vote cast: **YES** on "constitutive character" for 德. It combines the best elements -- "constitutive" signals the constructivist bottom-up process, "character" is universal and free of moral baggage. Good compromise.
